choices: lying on the warm sand of a beach.
1.content:
The glow of the rock.

That was the last thing you remembered before you blacked out. You remembered finding a strange glowing rock on the ground, and reaching your hand out to touch it. You also remembered having a vision after touching the rock, and seeing the image of these gigantic anthros, wearing clothing and talking.

As your mind started to slow down, your surroundings came into view. You looked around, finding that you were...
1.title: The Journey Begins

11.content:
You look around at your surroundings and immediately notice that you are in a extremely large house. The interior is rather simple and doesn't seem extravagant at all. You appear to be in the living room since there are a few couches, a T.V., and some furniture. To get a better view of your surrounding you climb to the top of a nearby coffee table and look around. The first thing you see makes you gasp in shock. It's a giant picture of a family of anthro dragons. It looks like a mom, a dad, and two children. One of the children appears to be a teenage girl (about 16 same age as you) and the other is a boy (about 12 looking).
         "It can't possibly be real." You say as you reach out and touch the image. The ground suddenly begins to rattle beneath you and you turn to see...
11.title: Inside a huge house.

choices: She finds you but isn't mad
111.content:
You turn around and can't believe what you're seeing. The giant Teenage dragon from the photo is heading out towards the living room. You act fast and dive behind the photo frame, you're not sure how she would react to you being in her house uninvited so you take no chances.
         "Ahhh... what a day." The anthro dragoness says as she sits on the coach. You peek out from behind the photo frame to get a better look at her. She is an average height (but absolutely massive to you) with purple colored scales. Her clothes seem pretty casual and you assume she just came back from school.
         "A-choo!" You suddenly sneeze and duck back behind to photo.
         "Is someone there?" The dragoness says as she sits up a little. She sniffs the air a little bit and continues to look around.
111.title: The giant teenage girl dragon

choices: Asks you what you are (there are no other humans in... where ever you are)
Smiles nicely at you as she realizes what you are (humans are all small here)
1111.content: "What's this?" You hear her say. You feel a tug on the back of your collar and you are promptly lifted into the air. The Dragoness lifts you up in front of her face to get a better look at you. You can feel her hot breath coming out of her nostrils located right on the tip of her snout. Her crystal-like eyes feel like they're piercing through your very body and soul. You snap back into reality as she begins to tilt you around a bit with a slightly bewildered look on her face. When she finally stops inspecting you she brings you back in front of her face and...
1111.title: She finds you but isn't mad

choices: Before you can respond her parents come home and she stuffs you in her pocket
You explain how you got here
11111.content:
"What are you?" The magnificent creature asks,
         "I-I'm a human." You stutter. She suddenly gasps like she had just been bitten,
         "Y-you can talk?" This time she stutters.
         "Well of course I can. Haven't you ever seen a human before?"
         "No, whatever you are you've never been seen by any of my kind." She responds. She continues to stare at you in a shocked state (making you slightly uncomfortable) and says "You seem to have the same general shape as us but I've never seen anything that looks quite like you."
         "Really? Well I've never seen anything that looks like you before." You say,
         "Then were are you from? There's no way you could be from my planet and not have heard of us." She says.
11111.title: Asks you what you are (there are no other human...

choices: You begin with proper introductions (You don't even know each others names yet)
111111.content:
You open your mouth to respond but just as you do, you hear the opening of a door.
         "Hello! Anyone home?" You hear someone yell.
         "Oh no! It's my parents!" The dragoness says, she then quickly shoves you into her side pocket just as her parents walk in. From inside the pocket you overhear the family exchange greetings and make small talk for a while. Your teenage mind quickly loses focus and your thoughts begin to wander... You open your eyes. You feel weightless, as though gravity is no longer holding you down. Darkness is all around you and the air feels... tight, like the breath is being stolen from your lungs. A hooded figure appears before you,
         "You have come here for a reason. This world is threatened by evil and you must now save it." The figure says then begins to fade.
         "Wait! What are you talking about? How could I possibly help if I'm so... small" but the figure vanishes before you can finish the sentence. Your eyes open once again to see the face of the dragoness right in front of you. As you look around you notice that she has taken you into a different room than before (it looks like her bedroom) and is holding you in her hand with a concerned look on her face.
         "Are you alright?" She asks,
         "Yeah, just dosed off for a second." You respond.
111111.title: A close call, and a warning...

1111111.content:
"So, what's your name?" The dragoness asked you.

"My name is Kevin Clash, what's yours?" Kevin Clash introduced himself to the dragoness.

"Well, my name is Mirabel Flare" Mirabel Flare introduced herself as the door opened, revealing...
1111111.title: You begin with proper introductions (You don...

11111111.content: You hear a thunderous boom, "SIS MOM WANTS YOU!". You scream at the pain, he hears that and comes in. He sees you and smiles,"ooo a human? Can i have him?"
11111111.title: Her brother

111111112.content:
"No Daniel, you can't! He's a human, he doesn't belong to anyone." Mirabel Flare explained to her younger brother.

"Oh okay, big sis." Daniel Flare sighed as he looked at Kevin Clash. He had similar scales to Mirabel, but his eyes were brown and had short hair.

"So Kevin, why exactly are you here?" Mirabel asked the small human. Kevin Clash thought for a moment, wondering about why exactly he had came to this world.

"I'm not really sure, to be completely honest." Kevin Clash tried to answer the question.

"Hey, I heard about things like you in a...
111111112.title: No

1111111121.content:
"Really? Which comic book?" Mirabel Flare asked her younger brother, who began to rummage through his backpack. After waiting for a minute, Daniel Flare pulled out an issue of Tales of Scary Beasts. The style the comic book seemed similar to Tales of the Crypt, a comic series that Kevin Clash had read when he was younger.

"This one is about a human who comes into a dimension of giant anthropomorphic animals." Daniel Flare told his older sister and her tiny guest the plot of the comic book.

"Then what happens?" Kevin Clash asked Daniel Flare with a piqued interest.

"Well, he saves a bunch of girls from slavery and becomes a hero." Daniel Flare explained happily.

"Slavery? That never happens here." Mirabel Flare noted as she began to think.

"Then why do you think I was brought here?" Kevin Clash asked the two dragon siblings.

As the three were now thinking, the door began to knock. Mirabel Flare handed Kevin Clash to Daniel Flare. Quickly checking the door, Mirabel Flare saw a girl named Darla Paw on the other side. She was about the same age as Mirabel Flare, and was an anthropomorphic...
1111111121.title: comic book once."

11111111212.content:
Darla Paw was about the same age as Mirabel Flare, and was an anthropomorphic wolf. Her fur was a glistening, bright gray color, her eyes a yellow like the full moon at night. Wearing a t-shirt with a scientific equation and wearing glasses as well, Kevin Clash guess that this Darla Paw must be some huge nerd. Being let inside by Mirabel Flare, Darla Paw was carrying three textbooks and some papers.

"Hello, Mirabel! Are you ready to study?" Darla Paw asked her friends.

"Wait, what test?" Mirabel Flare responded with a question.

"The test on Friday, don't you remember?" Darla Paw questioned her friend. After thinking for a second, Mirabel Flare's eyes widened, now remembering everything.

"Oh right, but I've got something to show you." Mirabel Flare told Darla Paw, nodding for her younger brother. Daniel Flare nodded and brought the tiny Kevin Clash to Darla Paw.

"Oh my gosh! He's so cute!" Darla Paw cried out happily as she looked at Kevin Clash. She inspected the tiny human male, adjusting her glasses occasionally.

"Well Kevin, this my friend Darla." Mirabel Flare introduced her friend to Kevin Clash.

"It's nice to meet you, Darla." Kevin Clash replied happily.

"Hey, there's something on the news, should we watch it?" Daniel Flare asked the group of three.
11111111212.title: Wolf

111111112121.content:
"Sure, what's going on in the news?" Mirabel Flare replied as she and Darla Paw sat down on the couch with Daniel Flare. Remembering her friend, Mirabel Flare put Kevin Clash on her shoulder so he could see.

"And for tonight's main story," TV Reporter Jack Pounce began, "The eighth girl this year has gone missing, again due to unknown circumstances."

The image of the girl quickly appeared on the television screen. Her name listed was Linda Soar, an anthropomorphic parrot girl. Her feathers were red, and had a small bow in her short hair. She was wearing a blue shirt and green pants, which almost seemed to match her feather color.

"Oh my gosh! That's one the cheerleaders!" Darla Paw gasped as she covered her mouth.

"This is just like the comic book, girls start to go missing in the beginning!" Daniel Flare declared, jumping up and down energetically.

"Don't be silly, she's probably just lost." Darla Paw tried to debunk the comic book.

"Well, shall I make dinner? It's starting to get a bit late." Mirabel Flare offered the group.
111111112121.title: Yes

11112.content:
“What you humans like? Oh-oh! We can share secrets together! You go first.” She says as she smiles nicely at you.
You tell her your most emberrassing thing: well uhh, *cleans throat* I have a foot fetish...

“Oh...” she says “do you rlly like that cuz I work at a kind of stripclub, we do things like vore or unbirth... but we do also things like foot stomp and foot worship”
You: “ wait... do u mean you wanna do it right now?... cuz if yah I’m ready babe!! Hhaha nah just kidding, buttuh, okay lets do it”

She: so, what would you like?
11112.title: What do you like?!

1112.content:
You stood there as quiet as you could be, maybe she wouldn't see you behind the family photo as long as you don't make a single sound. Too late for you, you sensed her head beginning to move towards the picture. Your heart skip a beat as she begin to move closer and closer to your exact location. And just as she was about to a take small peak behind it, you suddenly heard a sound coming from somewhere which caused the dragoness to quickly look straight towards the door, apparently it must be the sound of a door knock. "Ah they're here" you heard the giantess said as she rushed towards the door. You watch as she soon opened the door and outside the door, you saw three enormous beings standing outside. "I'm so glad you guys came over so quickly" she said as the three giants walked right inside the house and into the living room

In this perspective, you got a better view at these giants (noticing that they're also female anthros): One looked to be a gigantic anthropomorphic hare with long black hair who looked to be one year older than the dragon girl plus more fashionable. She's also wearing a short pink T-shirt with a floral pattern across it, a sky blue mini-skirt, and a pair of black knee-high boots. Another one appeared to be an anthropomorphic caribou with short brunette hair and glasses, by the looks of it, she seems to looked to be the smartest of the group and is about the same age as the dragon girl. She's wearing a lavender long-sleeved sweater, a light-green skirt, and a pair of blue and white shoes. And finally, the last one is an anthropomorphic ferret with long red hair who seems to be the youngest and shyiest of the group. She's wearing a long-sleeved blue shirt, short jeans, and a pair of long black socks and red mary-janes. You quickly realized that these girls appeared to be the friends of the dragoness

You hear the giantesses beginning to have a conversation with each other and heard that they're planning to...
1112.title: The arrival of the three friends

choices: She Doesn't Let Him Out, But Doesn't Digest Him Either
11122.content:
You see a window on the other side of the room and decide to try and get to it, you start running across the floor, but you are stopped by the dragon girl's giant foot, she looks down at you standing by her foot and picks you up bringing you to her face, "A human?" she says confused, "Uh, Hi, I'm lost" you say, she just stares at you for a few seconds, then takes a long lick spreading across your whole body with her hot, wet tongue, "They do taste good" she says to herself, "What?!" you yell, "I'm sorry little guy, there's just no place for you here except here" she says pointing at her stomach, You start to panic knowing what she's about to do, She opens her mouth allowing you to see her uvula and slimy, pulsating throat, she then places on her tongue and closes her mouth sealing you in, she tastes you for a big, completely covering you in her saliva then tilts her head back and swallows. She traces you down her throat with her finger enjoying the feeling of you wiggling in her throat. You know you can't escape her hot, wet, tight throat, but that doesn't stop you from trying.

You eventual slide all the way down her throat and land in her smiley, contracting stomach. You hear it gurgling and see your sitting in stomach acid. "Please! Please let me out!" you yell, "I'm sorry little guy, but there's no way you'd survive as a human, someone else would eat you, so it's better I eat you now and get it over with" she says trying to justify it, "Now digest quietly please" she added. You lay down up against the stomach walls and fall asleep waiting for the inevitable.

When you wake up you realize your fine, did she change her mind and not digest you or something, or does it take this long you wondered. "Hey!" you yell, "Why haven't you digested me?" you said, "I don't know, maybe because you don't deserve it and I felt to guilty" she said, "Really? Well Can I come out?" you asked, "No, I haven't made up my mind yet, so be quiet or I might digest you" she said, you kept quiet trying to not anger her.
11122.title: Hungry Dragon

111222.content:
For most of that day, you got to experience what like for the dragoness was like from the inside. You could feel evry step she took, however, she was the only thing from the outside you could hear with out being muffled to inaudibility. You sat sat there agenst the stomach wall, she had, only an hour ago, finished dinner, some of the remnants of the cheese burger still in the chamber with you. The digestion relly brought the horrid smell inside her to new life. As you sat there, you felt like a prisoner on death row hoping for a pardon, making deals with with what ever gods you could think of. Eventually she spoke up.

"You don't deserve this, your not like the other humans, you didn't want to come hear. But, I can't let you out either, I know you have no reason to trust me, but what I said was true, if I let you go, you would have just ended up in someone else."
111222.title: She Doesn't Let Him Out, But Doesn't Di...

11123.content:
From where you are, you have heard about the ongoing conversation among these giant teenage anthros and soon you discovered that they are planning to go somewhere else. You think that maybe you could see the rest of this strange world that is filled with enormous anthropomorphic creatures of many types by going along with them without neither of their notice yet you need to find something to ride on to do so. Looking around the table, you finally spotted a large pink purse laying down on it's side, presumably belonging to one of these giantesses. You could just rush and sneak inside there in order to go with them unknowingly but you'll also risk of getting caught by them because you'll end up moving away from your hiding spot. Looking at them, you saw that they are too engrossed on their conversation with each other, giving you a chance to go straight ahead to the giant purse. Taking a deep breath, you ran quickly towards the purse.

Fortunately for you, neither of the giant anthros saw you and soon you finally made it to the purse. You noticed that it seems to be half-opened which provides an easy route for you to crawl inside.

Once you almost got inside of it, you try hear about their plan to go someplace and discovered that the place they are going is...
11123.title: ...go someplace else.

choices: It's coming from upstairs (They're playing in their friend's room)
It's coming from the backyard (They're splashing around in the pool)
111231.content:
According to the giantesses, they're all planning to go to the house of yet another one of their friends. "I wonder what will they do there?" you though as you suddenly saw the giant dragoness making her way towards the purse that you're in. You quickly hide deep among the giant objects inside as you begin feel yourself getting lifted up of the ground when she starts to pick up her purse. Your surroundings have become dark as she zips her purse. Finally, you felt yourself swaying from side to side as she now begins to walk out of her house and into the street in order to visit the house of her fourth friend that is somewhere around the suburban neighborhood. You try to get comfortable in the bottom of the purse and hope that you don't get crush by the giantess' belongings which all looked big enough to break every bones of your body. Since she completely closed her purse, you're unable to look around the outside world, but by the looks of it, she seems to know where she's going so you just sit there and wait patiently for her and the others to visit the home of their friend.

For about twenty-five minutes, the giantess finally stops walking, revealing that the giantesses have finally reach the home of their mysterious friend. You heard yet another conversation among the friends, but this time due to how deep you are inside the purse, you couldn't make out what they're saying. After a few minutes, you suddenly felt yourself dropping into the ground, presumably that the dragoness have dropped her purse into the floor. Luckily, none of her enormous belongings didn't landed upon you. You decided to climb out of the purse and into where ever you are right now. Unfortunately due to the object blocking the exit, it'll might take several minutes to climb out of it. You start by climbing on top of a giant iphone, followed by a pencil, then a piece of bubblegum, and soon climb up a few other things.

After a long, tiring climb up the giant objects, you finally reached the exit of this giant purse and right at the corner of your eyes, you see a small opening that leads to the outside world; it seems that the dragoness didn't completely closed up her purse. You walked towards the small space and crawled out of it.

You step into the ground and look around, you found yourself inside a living room which looked similar to the last one, but a little different. There appears to be no one in this room right now, but you do heard voices of the giantesses coming from somewhere around here...
111231.title: ...a another friend's house

choices: Splash! You slip and fall into the pool!
You keep your balance, but you've been spotted!
1112312.content:
(All credits goes to the interactive story's creator themselves)

You hear an array of cheerful voices accompanied by the telltale sound of water being splashed about. With this information, it seems pretty obvious that the girls must be having some fun in the pool. Well, might as well go and say your hellos. After all, what could possibly go wrong?

For starters, the ungodly long trek to the actual pool itself went very wrong. Most of your energy reserves had been used up while climbing out of the dragoness' purse, so the walk out of the gigantic living room and through the open backyard door was incredibly taxing. During the journey outside, you stop to examine a few of the photos hanging on the wall. Tons of family pictures showcase a group of hares in their seemingly happiest moments, from birthdays to important school events. Looks like this house belongs to that highly fashionable hare you glimpsed earlier. Speaking of which, you could see that very hare and her friends just up ahead. Hopefully that long walk would pay off after you introduced yourself. As you approached the group of friends, you ran over what you would say in your head, until finally you stood at the edge of the pool.

"HEADS UP, EVERYBODY!!!" The dragoness laughed cheerfully, raising her hand high into the air.

"W-Wait a minute! You're going to get us all-" The ferret girl stuttered nervously, but before she could finish her sentence the dragoness brought her hand slamming down onto the pool's surface, spraying all her friends with water. Unfortunately, you were standing right in the splash zone.

You sputter madly, trying to get your now-soaked hair out of your eyes. Unable to see, you take a step forward and feel your leg start to slide out from under you due to the slippery nature of the poolside's wet tiling...
1112312.title: Poolside Perils

choices: You continued to focus on your plan
11123121.content:
SPLASH!!!!!!!!

You felt a massive gallon of water hitted your entire body as you soon found yourself floating across it. For a few seconds, you slowly opened your eyes and saw almost nothing, but blue. However, about several feet across you were a bunch of strange structures that almost looked like...legs? After this, you quickly found out that they were actually the giant legs of those four anthros from before. You watched as they sway, twist, twirl, and even nuzzled on each other. You don't know why, but watching how they looked gigantic and you being about nearly the size of flea makes you suddenly get a second thought. The brand-new thought doesn't seemed to involved in getting their attention and seemed to be a little more....personal. They even looked big enough for you to crawl around without their knowledge. You swam up to the surface and see them still continuing in their pool time fun. Maybe getting their attention doesn't seem to be your motive anymore...
11123121.title: A brand-new motive?

111231211.content:
Gaining enough confidence, you make your way across the water and straight towards your destination. You have decided to do a bit of exploring on their bodies; you wondered what's it like to be a tiny flea on a giant animal (or a dragon). After a while, you stop just a few miles away from them and stood there, thinking a moment. You look at all four of them and wondered which of these giantesses should you start first. You decided to save both of the caribou and ferret girl for later since they don't seemed to make an interesting exploration as much as the hare girl and the dragoness; it all leaves to those two.

The hare girl is the oldest and tallest of the group so she could leave plenty of open spaces for you to explore plus her grey fur seemed pretty soft too. The dragoness on the other hand doesn't have fur obviously, but her purple scales could make an interesting adventure too like exploring a vast desert of scales.

Which path do you choose?
111231211.title: Let's go exploring!

112.content:
A large, mildly chubby dragon walking down the hall, eyes groggy and half asleep. He has a teal scale color and a seafoam green stomach, he was the young boy in the photo. He stood right next to the couch across from the coffee table you hid on. He stretched out his arms and yawned. "AAAAHHHHH. A nice Saturday morning. No school, no homework, and the beginning of a week off." He jumped on to the couch and gained a new sense of energy. "Plus, with my parents on my vacation, i can watch cartoons all i want." He began to look around for the remote. "Now where is the remote?" He started looking on the ground and in the cracks of the couch.
The color on your skin turned pale as you saw the remote right next to you, in fact, in order to get to it, he'd most likely have to cross paths with your location. "Oh crap." You wanted to move, but you were petrified.
"Oh, there it is!" You heart skipped a beat. "Hnnggg.. almost reaching it...!" SWWOOMPF! The picture stand fell over with you exposed and standing right next to the remote...
112.title: Saturday couch slouch

choices: Froze with a hand over you..
1121.content:
The dragon bot gasped. He took his hand back and stared at you for a moment. Then simply said: "You're a... a human!" He sat up straight keeping his eyes on you, then shifted his vision left and right and back to the hallway. You were becoming increasingly scared from this monsters simple movements. He then reached right next to you for the remote, making jump in surprise and fall backwards. He paused looked at you again, slowing his movement more. "Hey, calm down, i'm not gonna hut ya, just turning on the TV that's all." He grabbed the remote, scanned the surface of it,then hit the power button. The screen behind you lit up and was at a medium set volume. "There, now my stupid sister won't hear me." You turned to look at the TV. It was like normal television, the channel on the equivalent of Disney or something, but it was casted by anthros not humans. You jumped slightly as you were lifted up by two scaly digits, more so even scared when you became eye-level with the giant
"Pl-please don't eat me! I wouldn't taste good, I swear!" You pleaded with your hands together, the fear of becoming a morning snack was seeping through your body, but all that was relieved when the boy responded.
"What? Oh- you think i was going to- i wasn't go to eat you." You sighed and closed your eyes for a moment, quick to open them again to be aware. "Heh heh, no, I would never eat something living, let alone something that could. Or a human for that matter! Your like a legend to us!" This got your attention; a legend? What did he mean. His eyes wandered all over you, and once sniffed you. He was very curios, and more than excited.
You brought enough courage up to ask him to let you down. "As great as the view is up here, could- could you possible but me down?" You were becoming afraid of heights, he wasn't exactly holding you over the table anymore, let alone anything soft.
He snapped out of a daze. "What? Ummm... oh yeah. Ok." He looked around seemingly trying to find a spot before he looked back at you, leaning back onto the couch. "Umm, well there isn't that great of a selection of safe seats- and i don't want to sit on you or anything- so i hope you like pudge." He gently placed you on his stomach, while he sat back in a slouched position, while you weren't that tiny, about five inches, his body seemed still massive to you. The warmth from the massive gut was comfortable and honestly you had thought his scales would be hard and cold, but were rather soft and squishy, very much like skin. You cautiously sat down facing his grinning face, small giggles were elicited when you shifted a bit.
"So-so...ummm yeah i'm human. Whats so special about that?" He smiled again, but to you it looked like a display of razer sharp teeth.
"Well, to be plain... humans don't exist... well shouldn't exist, they're just a myth." You looked in surprise, it was a logical reason for his great interest in you, and why everything in this world seemed to be comprised of anthros. "But you, you're real." He lifted a finger up to you and gently nudged you bringing back his finger and giggling. He seemed so content just to look at you. "To think, a real human! And a nice one too!"
Just then, he heard a voice coming through the halls "Lysander! Turn down that damn TV,it's Eight in the morning, and it's a Saturday, can't you just play in your room!" His sister was stomping down the hallway getting closure, your heart pounding. He looked down to you quickly with troubled eyes and...
1121.title: Just a Myth

11211.content:
As quick as a flash your whole body is grabbed an plunged into darkness, your heart pounding heavily, quickened by the young dragon boys swift move. You knew exactly where you were and didn't glance forward for the prospect of his privacy. He was easily trying to avoid any type of conflict between him and his sister, so you guessed the logical thing to do was to hide you... but why did he have to place you here. You overheard their conversation.

"Lysander, i know its a Saturday and all, but seriously, this is too early for cartoons." She walked into the kitchen, how you knew this was possible was by the small clicking of her feat against the tile. "And why are you hunched over like that?" She decidedly walked closer to Lysander, he began to blush and subsequently gripped just a bit tighter.

"N-Nothing I wasn't doing anything..." He looked nervously back and forth across the room. His sister came to the side of the sofa and peered down to his arching body, noticing how one hand was in his pants. She grimaced in disgiust.

"Ugh, Lysander, couldn't you go in your room and do that, not on the couch!" She sighed and walked back to her room, retorting back in a pissed off manner fashion: "Uegh, puberty." SLAM

The door closed shut and you still hid there against his palm and his soft fleshy scales, honestly it was kinda of nice to have a warmth like this, the only thing making you feel the most awkward was the smell: it was a musty young smell, all too familiar with you when had 'alone' time. In unison, the two of you sighed, the hand gripping you once more to bring you out of his commando pants. He nervously brought you back out of the humid prison and into fresh air, something that was so relieving to you. "Oh man-phew- that was a close one!" He reached for the remote and shut off the obnoxious TV.

You were still in his grasp, but you weren't minding being held by someone who obviously had a mindset of keeping you safe. "Th-thanks. Who knows what she would think of me." You slouched in his hand relaxing, knowing you were safe. But the smell still lingered a bit.

He slowly stood up and began walking to his room, passing through the hall and hearing his sisters loud audible snoring, a thing uncommon for a beauty of her kind. Lysander stuck his tongue out in front of her door, making you smile in amusement. "She woulda probably thought you were a rodent or something...*sniff, sniff* Oh.." He lowered his snout to you, gently sniffing then backing away with a slight blush on his face. "I-im sorry man... i wasn't thinking- y'know- about where to hide you and i just-"

"It's alright,no harm done, besides, i know what it's like to go through this." He was still blushing just entering his room,it was like a normal teens room; posters on the wall,computer and a desk, a drawer. It was so similar to a regular humans, it was astonishing.

"Thanks for understanding.At least i didn't push you too low... wait did I?" You laughed and shook your head. "By the way, never got a name from you- you know mine
already, so whats yours?" He sat on his bed and looked at you with a stargazed expression, like you were a trophy or something. Leaning on his right hand, while you were still up to your arms in his grasp.

"Umm.. how bout you set me down first." Lysander quickly apologized and set you near the end of his bed, laying belly down and feet near the head post, arms crossed and staring at you intently, his tail wavering in the air. "First off,my name is Jack, and second of all, i have no idea how i got here. So with your help- if you'd be willing to help me- i'd like to get back to my own world."

"Oh, i'd love to help you get back!... but ummm.... how? I can't think of anything to help get you back?" He showed a face of discontent and sighed, then snapped up again with energy grinning with all his razor sharp teeth, still freaking you out. "I KNOW! I can search some stuff up on my computer-" *GRRRRGLLRGGRLL* He slid a hand down to his stomach. You backed up in a bit of fear. He noticed.:Oh..heh heh, sorry, right after breakfast. By the way, ummm,how old are yah? Im thirteen."

You wiped your forehead a little, the thought of still being dropped into his boiling stomach was enough to get you sweating. "Im sixteen."

He began to get up leaning on his hands, "Sooo, what do you humans eat?"...
11211.title: Small scent of puberty

choices: You head off to the park
There was someone at the door
112111.content:
"Well, that would depend on what you have in the kitchen." you reply.

"Okay, let's just go and check anyway."

Lysander places a palm next to you, which you climb up on. He takes you down the same hall, passing by his sister's room with the same snoring still heard from it, and soon the two of you were in the kitchen. Despite the size, everything seemed the way how you would have expected a kitchen to be like. There was a fridge to the wall, the counter tops and sink, a table in the middle of the room, cabinets, an oven and microwave at one corner, and even a pantry on one side. The dragon teen gently places you on the table and begins rummaging through the cabinets, looking for something.

"I think I'll just have a bowl of cereal for today. How about you?"

"Yeah, I can go for some myself." you reply.

Pulling out a box, he places it on the table and goes looking for a bowl. You inspect the box, which must've been around the size of an office building to you. On the front, of course, is some kind of cartoon character; a brown-furred wolf holding a spoon to his mouth in one hand, and the bowl of the cereal on the other. Moving to the back, the print went on about how it contained the essential vitamins and minerals every child needs, and stuff. Looking back to your friend, you see him already holding a bowl in one hand, and the other in the fridge. Taking out the milk, Lysander is already at the table with you, preparing his bowl. Once he was done, he puts a hand in the box and pulls out a single piece.

"Here ya go! I'm sure that you're hungry too, Jack."

He places the food next to you, which must've been the size of a beach ball to you, at least! It was really just a simple spherical piece of brown chocolate cocoa, but that was your favorite kind of cereal. You both start digging in, enjoying your breakfast with your gigantic anthro friend. It was about a few minutes when you were both done. You couldn't finish your meal, of course, but you did take quite a chunk out of it. Lysander was drinking the last drops of milk before he placed the bowl back on the table.

"Aah! That was good!"

"Boy, you said it."

Seeing your unfinished piece of cereal, he plucks it from you and pops it into his mouth. For a moment, you felt a tinge of fear as you almost thought he was trying to eat you. But you start reprimanding yourself for thinking that. He's been nice to you this whole time, wasn't he? Not to mention the fact he just ate breakfast...

"So, ready to see if we can find a way back home for you?"

"You bet!"

The two of you make your way back to the dragon's room. He sits on the desk in front of his computer and he places you in front of him. Starting it up, you watch as the humungous screen flickers into life and flashes bright lights in front of your eyes. Lysander quickly adjusts the light until it was dim enough for you to see it. "Sorry, forgot to set the brightness level yesterday." Blinking the lights out of your vision, you watch as he begins opening up a net program, and it immediately opens up to a search site.

"So, what was it that got you here in the first place?"

"Some kind of glowing rock. All I remember is that when I touched it, everything went black, and here I am."

"Okay, let's try it...Glowing rock..."

in a few seconds, the search results came up, with several pages worth of possible matches. The first one was useless, and so was the next one...And the next one...And that one is just an ad! You yawn a bit as you just stare at the screen, uninformative sites scrolling by. But then, you spot a picture of something that seemed all too familiar to you.

"Stop!"

"What? What is it?"

You point at the picture. It was a rock, but it wasn't glowing like how you remember it. However, you do see a carving of some kind of magic circle on it. When you touched that rock, you only managed to catch a glimpse of that carving when you were whisked away to this world. But you were sure that that was the same carving you saw. Lysander quickly goes to the page where that picture was, and the site led you to what seemed to be some kind of document, or some informational piece.

         This is the legendary "Winlow's Stone" which has been said to have the power to take it's owner to another world. The stone itself contains potent magical power, which allows it to travel to another realm, even without an owner. Once in possession, the owner can use it to travel to different worlds or dimensions at will. However, if no one possesses the stone for a certain amount of time, it's magical powers will transport it to a random world. This amount has been deduced to be a minimum of 48 hours to any point afterwards. When it teleports, any creature or object within it's range will be transported alongside it, but will be sent to a different location from where the stone itself will be transported too. This object may be one possible explanation to OOParts (Out Of Place artifacts) found within a number of locations of our world, but no evidence can prove this. However, several accounts have been reported of a sudden flash of mysterious light, with no apparent source.

You and Lysander look at each other with grave faces. If this document was true, then that means you only have two days at least to find it, and return to your world...Or end up stuck in this world forever...

"...S-so...At least we know what we're looking for...Right Jack?"

"Y-yeah...You'll help me out with this, right?"

"Of course I will! I mean, we're friends, aren't we? And besides, if we're too late, you can live with me and we can be the best of friends so you won't feel lonely. But, that would mean..."

Yeah, you already knew what he was going to say, before he even said it. It would mean having to meet with the rest of the family.

"Anyway, let's worry about that only if we are too late." you say.

Lysander opens up another search site and types in "Winlow's Stone". This time, there were only a few good matches. All the rest just led off to something else entirely. Taking a look, it seems that there's a list of places where OOParts have been found in this world.

"Hey! This one's where they have that digging site next to the park! It looks like they found a slightly radioactive object there, but there were no recordings that can explain why." Lysander explains.

"Well, that's pretty much the best place to start looking." you say.
112111.title: The Search Begins

choices: She suddenly opens the door, and sees you!
Oh wait, there's the snoring again...
1121112.content:
Lysander was packing some stuff into a backpack. You sat there and watched as he packed in some food, a first-aid kit, some walkie-talkies, and a notepad and pencils.

"Er, what are those things for, exactly?" you ask.

"Well, it's just in case something happens. The walkie-talkies are just so we happen to need help, and the notepad is in case we need to write something down, or take notes of something. After all, It doesn't look like Winlow's Stone is gonna be easy to track down, right?"

You nod your head, understanding. Lysander was actually a pretty smart guy, and his explanation helped ease your earlier worry. Just as Lysander finishes packing things up, you both hear an audible ring of the doorbell. He's already taken out a pair of pants to change into.

"Huh, I wonder who that could be?" Lysander muses.

He picks you up and makes his way over to the door. He then hides you behind his back as you hear the front door open.

"Hey Lysander! I just bought a cool game I thought you'd like! Wanna set it up in your room now?" the person says.

"Oh, sorry Tagro, but I-I've got somewhere to go."

You hear the gentle squeak of the door closing, only for a soft thud to stop it.

"C'mon Lysander! You'll love this game, I promise!" Tagro says.

"No! It's really important that I go out right now..."

"What? But I spent a lot of cash on this game! Hey, what's that behind your back?"

You tense up, knowing that you're at risk of getting discovered. Lysander seems to be fidgeting around, as you can see with how his arms is moving around.

"N-nothing Tagro! I don't have anything behind my back!"

"Come on, show me! I'm your friend, after all."

"Ngh...A-alright, but only my room!"

Lysander quickly turns around and rushes into his room, you in hand and Tagro following behind. As the two of you reach the door, Lysander looks back to Tagro, with you still out of sight.

"Okay, promise that you will never ever tell anyone about this, ever." Lysander said.

"Uh, okay, I promise."

"No, you have to really promise to never tell anyone else without my permission!"

"Alright! I promise to never tell anyone! Now, will you please show me what it is you're hiding?"

Lysander slowly brings you in view. You blink as you see a giant anthro Bengal tiger, staring down at you. He seems to be around the same age as Lysander. His eyes are wide, and his lips seem to quiver slightly.

"A...A human? You've got a human!?" he says, unable to believe his own eyes.

"Yeah. There's this thing called Winlow's Stone, that transports anything near it to another world. Jack here was taken from his world to ours, and I'm gonna help him get back, no matter what."

You smile a little as you listen to Lysander's caring speech. He glances down at you with a smile before you both return your gazes to Tagro. The tiger anthro stops gawking and gives out a light chuckle.

"Heheh, Lysander, you were keeping this guy hidden from me? Why?"

"W-well, I'm just not sure how other anthros would react to seeing a real live human, considering the fact that they're not really supposed to exist, after all..."

Tagro just looks at you two and starts laughing. He holds his sides as you both just look at him like he's gone insane.

"Hahahaha! Lysander, you know that you can trust me! I would've agreed to helping him get back home if that was the case!"

"R-really!?" you say.

"Well yeah! But, what is this Winlow's Stone anyway?"

Lysander and Tagro sit down on the bed as you're placed on the bedside table. The two of you begin filling Tagro in with what you've learned so far, the tiger nodding in understanding.

"I see. Well then, we really should get to that park right now then, huh?" Tagro says, standing up.

Lysander tells Tagro and you to turn around as he switches to more proper clothing for outdoor activities. Once you're all prepared, you leave the room and pass by Lysander's sister's room. However, the snoring sound is no longer heard...Lysander and you glance at each other before looking back at the door.
1121112.title: Forming The Search Team

choices: You all go to the park now.
You try to go to the park, but something happens.
11211121.content:
The knob turns and the door opens, quicker than Lysander's reflexes could react. It was already too late as his older sister was already looking down at you.

"...Lysander, what is that?" she asked stiffly.

"U-um...A human." Lysander said awkwardly.

Your mind is already frozen, along with your friend. The atmosphere gets more and more awkward as she just stares at you in disbelief.

"I...Don't believe it..." she said.

"Um, can I say something?" Tagro said.

You all look at him, suddenly making him uncomfortable. He quickly regains his composure as he tries his best to explain.

"Y-you see, Jack, the human, he's not from this world. There's this magical thing, and it teleports stuff to other worlds, and, Jack is, well, a victim of it."

"Huh? But, that just sounds...Ridiculous!"

"But it's the truth, sis! How else could Jack be sitting here in my hand right now!" Lysander insisted.

Lysander's sister looked at you, thinking. The three of you practically held your breath, hoping that she would believe you all.

"Hmm...Okay, let's say that what you're saying is true. Then what are you two doing to him?" she asked.

"We're trying to help him find Winlow's Stone so we can bring him back to his world!" Lysander said.

"What, what!? What stone?"

You three fill her in on what you know, which isn't much. But when you tell her about where you're going, she suddenly freaks out.

"What!? Lysander, you are not going to a digging site! It's dangerous!" she said.

"But, it's the only clue we have!" Lysander said.

"That's right miss. Right now, it's the only chance I have." you say.

She looks at you with more pity than anger. After thinking it over, she sighs while shaking her head. "Wait here, I'll get changed."

"What!? Who said you were coming with us!?" Lysander protested.

"Listen here, kiddo. If you get hurt, I'll get the blame. So I'm not gonna let you go running around blindly looking for a glowing rock and probably get yourself killed. I'm coming with you, and that's final. Besides, I'm the older sister. That means I'm in charge, got that?"

You can feel Lysander's grip tighten a bit as the two siblings stare each other down. You knew that sibling rivalry can get pretty bad sometimes, but you just hope that Lysander doesn't accidentally squeeze you too much from it.

"F-fine! But, Jack is gonna be the leader of this search team, so you have to listen to him, alright!?" Lysander said.

"Fair enough. Now, stay put. I'll be out in a sec."

"Thank you for understanding, miss." You said.

"Oh, please! Just call me Elsa. Calling me miss makes me sound older."

"Don't you mean it makes you sound as old as you look?" Lysander slyly added.

Elsa hits his brother in the head before retreating back into her room. You got jogged pretty badly from the impact, so Tagro suggested holding you for now, which Lysander accepted. You could actually tell that he just wanted to hold you, but then again, you're mythical in this world!
11211121.title: Human Discovery

choices: Hold off on meeting your dad
112111212.content:
ou begin heading towards the door. Tagro is in the lead holding you carefully in his palm. Elsa and Lysander are right behind him. Tagro is just about to turn the knob when it turns on it's own. Thinking fast Lysander grabs you rather roughly and places you in the pocket of his jeans. You hear the door open and a loud male voice shout "I'm home!" You slowly peak your head out of Lysander's pocket and gasp quietly when you see an impossibly tall red dragon in a military outfit in front of you. Even by this world's standards the dragon had to be at least eight feet tall. He doesn't seem to notice you and instead turns his attention towards Elsa.

"Well this is a nice welcoming committee isn't it?" His voice is cheerful and full of life. He takes off his hat and reveals two large white horns. Elsa, Lysander and Tagro are left speechless. The red dragon frowns slightly. "What, no hug for your old man?" He asked. Lysander and Elsa suddenly come to life and hug their dad. Even looking up from this angle you can tell that Lysander's dad is a good two feet taller then Elsa and seems three feet taller then Lysander. "Ah, that's better", the large dragon says. "Now if you'll excuse me I have to call your mother. I know I just got back from overseas but apparently your mother was sent a strange stone from a friend of hers. Apparently her friend found a...ah what did she call it again? Oh, right a Winlow's Stone"

You suddenly feel very afraid. The dragon continues oblivious to your existence. "Anyway, it turns out that this stone may have some connection to humans. You kids know how your mother get's on the subject of humans. She obsessed with them and goes off in her own little world. Anyway, I'll take you kids out for lunch and we can have a nice long chat on how your year's going. Oh Tagro you can come to if you like." Just as Lysander's dad was about to walk into the kitchen Lysander stops him. "Dad wait." The red dragon turns and sees his son. "Yes, Lysander", his father asked? "Where did mom's friend find this Winlow's Stone?"

"Oh, I can see this subject has gotten your attention to", the red dragon comments. "Where dad", Lysander ask again? "Apparently your mom's friend found it in the construction site at the park and sent it right to her. All the way to Dragovin." Lysander's dad turned and walked into the kitchen. Leaving the three anthros and you alone. You couldn't believe it. The stone that could get you back to your own world again was now wherever this Dragovin was. You try to get Lysander's attention and he slowly picks you up and holds you in front of his face. A sadness in his eyes. "I'm sorry Jack", he says. "Don't be sorry", you say. "Maybe we can get to this Dragovin place, where is it?" "The other side of the world", Elsa answers.

Your heart falls. So that's it. Your stuck in this world, with no way to get home. What now? You look at Lysander and his eyes seemed to fill with tears. He really did want to help you. You pat his snout gently and he rubs his eyes and looks at you. He then looks to Elsa. You follow his gaze. She looks slightly less sad but looks at you with pity. You then look to Tagro who looks just as sad as Lysander. You wonder what to do now. You then think of a way to make Lysander happy again. "Hey look on the bright side Lysander", you start trying to cheer your new friend up. "At least will be friends forever, right?" Lysander looks at you. He can tell your just putting on a show to make him feel better, but it makes him smile all the same. "Right, so what should we do now?" He smiles back at you.

"Well if I'm gonna be here a while how about you introduce me to your dad. He seems nice." Your suggestion seems to make Lysander smile. "Yeah", your dragon friend agrees. "He is nice. But he's also really strong and tough. He's a general in the army and is often overseas so we don't get to see him that much. Sorry, I guess with all that's happened we forgot he was coming home today." Lysander seemed really interested in his dad's work. He went on and on about all that his dad did and the more you heard the more excited you were about meeting him. But you were also pretty nervous. If he really was as strong as Lysander said he was maybe you should wait to meet him. But then again his dad did seem nice so maybe it won't be so bad. Finally you interrupt your friend's rambling. "Lysander!" You shout. Lysander looked at you waiting to hear what you had to say. "Why don't we...
112111212.title: You try to go to the park, but something happens.

1121112121.content:
"Let's meet your dad", you say. Lysander agrees and places you gently back in his pocket. You peak your head out as Lysander, Tagro, and Elsa head into the kitchen. You see their dad sitting at the table patiently. You watch as Lysander makes his way to the other end of the table and Elsa and Tagro sit on either side of him. The red dragon notices them and asks what's up. You watch as Lysander fidgets with his fingers and tries to speak. you understand why he's worried. A mythical creature suddenly appears in your world and you've made friends with it. He's probably not sure how his dad will react. You notice your friend is having trouble and gently pull on his shirt to get his attention. He looks down at you and you whisper, "It'll be fine just tell him." Lysander smiles at you then turns his attention to his dad.

"Dad, I have something to tell you", Lysander begins.

'What is it son", his dad says? The red dragon notices Lysander's body movement and look on his face. He can tell it's something serious.

"Well, you know how we think humans are just a myth", Lysander begins. "Yes", his dad answers slightly confused and concerned. "Well their not just a myth anymore. Lysander's dad looks even more confused and Elsa pushes into the conversation.

"We've met one dad." At first the dad thinks this is a joke but then he sees his children's faces and realizes their serious. "Are you serious", he asked. "Where, when, how?"

"I met him a few minutes ago and Lysander met him this morning and Tagro met him before I did. Anyway he came to this world through the use of a Winlow's Stone and we were going to help him find another one to get him back to his world, but then you said that mom's friend sent it to her and now he's stuck here with us. He has no way to return home and the only people he knows are us. So we were hoping he could stay here with us."

(Lysander's dad point of view)

You looks at your children. If what they said was true. This could be a very important find. But you needed to see proof. You were sure this was just some prank. No way could a human exist. "Do you have him with you", you asked? All three nodded. "Then let me see him." You thought that you had them, You thought that they would pull a little doll out and you would all share a laugh but when Lysander reached into his pocket and held his hand out in front of you. You were shocked. There standing in your son's hand was a very tiny human. It looked like it had popped right out of the pages of a book.

(Jack's point of view)

You felt Lysander's hand close around you and pull you upwards. When he opened his hand again you looked up and saw the red dragon looking down at you, mouth agape. You watched as he shook his head and reached down to pick you up. You felt his finger's curl around your body and lift you up to his eye level. Unsure what to do you laugh nervously and wave to him saying, "hi." You watch the red dragon's and he is...
1121112121.title: Meet your dad

choices: To stay with your new friend and watch him play his game
To get Lysander to help you find a place to sleep
11211121212.content:
You watch as Lysander's dad holds you towards his chest level and very gently pokes you. The force easily knocks you down and he very gently picks you back up again. "Your real", he gasp. "A real live human." He sets you down on the table and looks at Lysander and the others. You follow his gaze and they all look very nervous, unsure of what's going to happen. You look back at the red dragon and he stares down at you. "How did you get here?" You launch into an explanation on how you got here, how you met Lysander, Tagro, and Elsa. You then explain that they agreed to help you get back home. But when you explain that the Winlow's Stone is on the other half of the world and you only had two days to find it and go back home, your voice starts to break as you say you'll never be able to get home.

You suddenly feel something gently touch your back. You look up and see the red dragon gently stroking your back. He has a smile on his face. "It's all right", he says. "If you can't get back home your more then welcome to stay with us." You wipe your tears away and look up hopefully. "Really", you asked? If you really were stuck here, then without anyone's help it would be very difficult to survive. "Really", answered the red dragon. "My son and daughter seem to like you and I'm sure my wife will be overjoyed at the fact that a real human is staying with us. So do you want to live with us if we can't find a way back to your own world." Before you answer you asked what did he mean if you couldn't find a way back home. You thought that there was no way for you to return with out the Winlow's Stone.

"No that's just all you know. There could be other ways for you to return that we just don't know about yet." Your eyes light up when you hear this. The red dragon continues. 'But if we can't find a way for you to return then, you can stay with us. So I'll ask again. Do you want to stay with us?" "Yes", you shout with joy. "Well looks like I have one more mouth to feed. Thankfully this one won't take much." You all laugh. "So human what's your name? Mine is Zilconis. General Zilconis." "My name is Jack", you answer. "Well Jack", Zilconis begins. "Welcome to our family." Zilconis turns his attention to his son. "Lysander." "Yeah dad." "Take your friend and our little guest upstairs with you and find him a safe place to sleep. I'll come up to check on you wants I finish talking to your mother over the phone."

With that said, Lysander gently picks you up and carries you upstairs. Tagro follows and Elsa stays behind to talk to her dad. "Awesome", shouts Lysander. I have a brand new friend and he's from another world and he's living with us." You can see your slightly chubby dragon friend smile with joy and for the first time in your life you feel safe and happy. "Hey, Lysander", Tagro calls out. "Why don't we play that new video game while Jack finds a place to sleep in your room." "I don't know Tagro, I don't feel right letting Jack explore my room at his size, without me with him. What if I lose sight of him. I could step on him, or he could get eaten by a bug. Also I think dad might be upset if I let anything happen to Jack on my watch. What do you think, Jack?" Your friend turns his attention to you and you decide...
11211121212.title: Curious and concerned

choices: Look at the time! It's lunch time already!
Better stop to prepare a bed for you. You still need one, after all.
112111212121.content:
"I think I'd like to stay close to you. Besides, I wouldn't mind watching you two play that game." you say.

Lysander chuckles as the three of you enter the bedroom again. Tagro picks up the game he put down, showing a somewhat cartoonish anthro with an eye patch throwing what looked like an energy punch towards the corner of the case. Must be a fighting game.

"Ultimate Brawlers 4! It's the newest addition to the series!" Tagro happily announced.

Lysander's eyes seem to sparkle as he looked at the case. He immediately went over to his TV, placing you under it before pulling out a gaming console in the cabinet underneath and plugging the whole thing in. You watch as the excited teen eagerly puts everything in its place before grabbing you again. The two anthros sit down on the floor, controller in front of them, as Lysander places you between them. The dragon turns everything on and takes out the disc from the case. So games look the same in this world too, huh? He pops open the console and places the disc inside, closing it and waited. The TV screen shows an intense scene, with similar music as various anthros appear two at a time, fighting each other. Lysander just stares in awe, as Tagro laughs.

"I told you you'd like it!" he said.

Lysander nods as the title finally comes up, along with the main menu. Your giant friends pick VS mode, as a roster of character portraits appear. Lysander picks a big burly grey dragon, while Tagro picks what looks like a slim cheetah with a headband. You watch as the match begins, with Lysander going on the offensive. Tagro blocks and counters the dragon's attacks, landing some good hits on Lysander's character.

"Dude, you're button mashing again." Tagro notes.

"Well it's what I always do when I don't know the moveset." Lysander replies.

You watch as after several seconds, Lysander's character lays on the floor flat with an empty health bar. The next few matches go by somewhat painfully, with Lysander losing round after round. Tagro was laughing while Lysander seemed to be losing his cool.

"Come on, how are you better at this than me?" the dragon asked, clearly frustrated.

"Skill dude, skill."

You put a hand to your chin, thinking about what you've witnessed. The battle system doesn't seem all that complicated. Heck, you're a bit of a gamer yourself in your world.

"Hey Tagro, mind if I give Lysander some tips?" you say.

The huge tiger teen looks down at you curiously.

"You understand this game, Jake?" he asks.

"I have video games in my world too, just so you know."

"Alright. Let's see how much good that'll do for him."

Lysander picks you up and sets you on his shoulder. You sit down as you put a hand on his cheek, smiling.

"Okay, Tagro's capture moves are slower than regular attacks. Use that time to hit him to cancel it out. Also, down forward punch. That's a really common combo in my world. Maybe your world's games use that too."

Lysander nods as another match starts. The big dragon takes your advice and begins doing better this time.

"Hey! I'm kicking your butt!" Lysander says.

Lysander's character throws what looked like an energy ball, and hits Tagro's character, knocking down his health to zero. Lysander pumps an arm up, laughing.

"Dude, I totally beat you!" he said.

"Lysander, that's just round one. Now I can really take my gloves off."

You feel a little intimidated by that, honestly. When the second round begins, Tagro starts off with a combo move, not giving Lysander any time to react.

"W-whoa! When did you..."

"I told you, skill."

Lysander attempts to fight back, but was either dodged or blocked. Tagro smiles as he quickly pushes the buttons with his thumbs, quickly defeating Lysander with a perfect health bar, no hits. Lysander seemed horrified, looking at Tagro as he smiles back.

"Jack! I need tips!"

"I...I honestly have nothing. Maybe if I was big enough to hold the controller..."

"Guys, calm down. It's just a game. We're supposed to be having fun, right? Anyway, I'll ease up on the third round, if it makes you feel any better." Tagro tells you.

Lysander looks at Tagro weirdly before smiling. The third round begins, and the two beat each other normally. Combos, throws, regular attacks, until Lysander was about to lose. Tagro comes in, but Lysander throws another energy ball, hitting Tagro and claiming victory.

"I won!" Lysander said happily.

"Yeah, but Tagro didn't even try to block that last attack." you say.

Lysander looks at you before turning to Tagro, who was still smiling.

"I just thought you could have this match. I already got a bunch before it anyway!" he says.

The three of you begin laughing as you continue your game.

You get out the room and no problems

"Alright boys it's time for bed off your game!" Lysander's father told the three of you. "Ok dad good night!" Lysander told him. You were in a tiny sleeping bag on Lysander's dresser. "Hey guys I say
let's sneak out to get that stone." Lysander told the both of you. "Ok let's do it quietly and no loud steps so we won't get caught." You told the both of them. You snuck to your parents room and got the stone.
1121112121212.title: Better stop to prepare a bed for you. You still...

choices: All of you search town to look for them
